closed_reason: Listed CLI commands from cmd/ticker/main.go: 4 subcommands - run (run epics with AI agent), resume (resume from checkpoint), checkpoints (list available checkpoints), upgrade (upgrade ticker to latest version). Root command 'ticker' has no default action but shows help. Commands defined using cobra.Command structs and added via rootCmd.AddCommand() in init().
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll start by reading the cmd/ticker/main.go file to list all CLI subcommands defined.

Based on reading cmd/ticker/main.go, I can now list all the CLI subcommands defined in this file. Let me close the task with the findings.

Task completed. Here's a summary of the CLI commands defined in `cmd/ticker/main.go`:

**Root Command: `ticker`**
- Autonomous AI agent loop runner
- Shows help when run without subcommands

**Subcommands (4 total):**

1. **`run <epic-id> [epic-id...]`** - Run one or more epics with the AI agent
   - Flags: `--max-iterations/-n`, `--max-cost`, `--checkpoint-interval`, `--max-task-retries`, `--auto`, `--headless`, `--jsonl`, `--skip-verify`, `--verify-only`, `--worktree`, `--parallel`

2. **`resume <checkpoint-id>`** - Resume from a saved checkpoint

3. **`checkpoints [epic-id]`** - List available checkpoints (optionally filtered by epic)

4. **`upgrade`** - Download and install the latest version of ticker

All commands use the cobra framework and are registered via `rootCmd.AddCommand()` in the `init()` function.

title: List CLI commands
